Hi Guys  my dad is 74 this year and has only $13k in his RA. I believe he is withdrawing about $300+ a month. My brothers and I thinking to top up his CPF via monthly $700 giro each. He will receive about $2.1k each month. May I know is there a way to increase his monthly payout?
Yes  recurring on LSE for USD shares is $1.70 (not inclusive of GST)

Like every other card? 3 to 5 business days?
Regardless of amount is that right?
Yea that’s the minimum if u are on the tiered comm structure. No more 0.38  IBKR fixed it already
As long as his RA is below FRS  any amounts topped up to his RA is eligible for tax relief (up to 8k). Topping up his RA also increases his monthly payouts.

Hi  i am going to book tickets with singapore airline about $4k  is it wise to use HSBC revo or DCS 2% cashback since i have both? And i read somewhere HSBC revo have cap of $1000?
Depend if u prefer cashback or miles. Revo bonus miles is cap at 1k
oh so it is true cap at 1k  what will happen for those over 1k? I am ok with both miles/cashback but with $4k charge just wondering if both have same value with 1k cap
4k will have better value on dcs card compare to revo
got it  thanks a lot Queenie

Yes  but Highflyer only can convert $30k to krisflyer per year  when I try to redeem the krisflyer point for a air ticket  seem like more worth it than just redeem the air ticket from Highflyer account
Newb here :I very recently got intro-ed to FWD Invest First Plus.Different ppl saying different things to me about this  is this 'plan' any good?

If you search ILP in this group you'll get all the info you need on why you should never get an ILP. 🤪But in short  fees  fees  fees and more fees.Initial account charge is fairly low compared to other companies  but the policy charge on the 2nd year onwards is disgusting.You can probably do better with robo advisors.
